channel.title: Running Client on linux help? please
channel.description:
Okay problem is :
Recently my computer melted, over use ftw? Anyone after the repairs have been made, I switched operating systems to Linux, ( more precise the most updated ubuntu version). For obvious reasons, I can't get the downloadable client to work. But the Web client is able to load and I can log on usually with no problem. The problem is that the web client application ( ? seems to stop responding ? ) just about when ever I do anything more then take a few steps, ( trading, multi clicking, banking , following ) and I get a greyish square in the place of where the game client used to be.
The script from the client is as followed : [code]@ECHO OFF
ECHO THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY
ECHO DOUBLE-CLICK THE "client.jar" TO RUN IT
ECHO -
ECHO Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)
@ECHO ON
"C:\Program Files (x86)\java\jre6\bin\javaw.exe" -Xmx512m -jar client.jar
@ECHO OFF
pause[/code]
before insulting me, Please understand I am completely new to linux

item.title: Running Client on linux help? please

either
a) use man
or b) google it.

item.title: Running Client on linux help? please
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Because according to c|p the shell script included with that jbe download has windows line endings, tofrodos/dos2unix will convert the line endings into a unix friendly format(hopefully fixing the shell script for you)

item.title: Running Client on linux help? please
item.dc:creator: @Ed_ere Ed_ere
item.description:
@Ed_ere wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:30, topic:344503”]eddw@ben-desktop:~/jbe$ ./jbe.sh
: No such file or directory

are you blind? or just purposely being retarded[/quote]

Firstly they both do exist infact I’m looking at the file right now.
Secondly I really do try to minimise the help needed, I google most things before asking for help.

Now back to the problem at hand. I used “apt-get dos2unix” in terminal and got "E: Invalid operation dos2unix So I am guessing I already have it?

I’m guessing I’m ment to convert the jbe.sh file? not sure on completely how at the moment though.

I do hope you appreciate my willingness to learn, And even though we haven’t reached the solution yet. you have all taught me a fair bit about working linux already.

Read full topic

the script has windows line endings in it for some reason
use dos2unix to fix it

item.dc:creator: @Ed_ere Ed_ere
item.description:
@Ed_ere wrote:

i did all that, but i still get this error when I do ./jbe.sh

eddw@ben-desktop:~/jbe$ ./jbe.sh : No such file or directory Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: ee/ioc/cs/jbe/browser/BrowserApplication Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: ee.ioc.cs.jbe.browser.BrowserApplication at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:321) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:266) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:334) Could not find the main class: ee.ioc.cs.jbe.browser.BrowserApplication. Program will exit.

I really don’t mean to intentionally get this wrong, Before the other day I hadn’t even heard of linux…

item.title: Running Client on linux help? please
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

what the fuck are you idiots doing

[ol][li]obtain archive (a gzipped tarball is used in the example to avoid the inevitable “help please? unzip: command not found”)[/li]
[li]extract archive[/li]
[li]move into extracted directory[/li]
[li]change file permissions of the script to allow execution[/li]
[li]run the script[/li][/ol]

wget http://s11.info/c/jbe-fixed.tar.gz tar xvzf jbe-fixed.tar.gz cd jbe chmod +x jbe.sh ./jbe.sh

Read full topic

item.title: Running Client on linux help? please
item.dc:creator: @Ed_ere Ed_ere
item.description:
@Ed_ere wrote:

thanks ecze for the suggestion, Tried everything you said. Here is the terminal history… Didn’t seem to work

eddw@ben-desktop:~$ sudo -i cd ~/jbe/ eddw@ben-desktop:~$ sudo -i sh jbe.sh sh: Can't open jbe.sh eddw@ben-desktop:~$ sudi -i chmod +x jbe.sh No command 'sudi' found, did you mean: Command 'sudo' from package 'sudo' (main) Command 'sudo' from package 'sudo-ldap' (universe) sudi: command not found eddw@ben-desktop:~$ sudo -i chmod +x jbe.sh chmod: cannot access `jbe.sh': No such file or directory eddw@ben-desktop:~$ sudo ./jbe.sh cd: 1: can't cd to bin Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: ee/ioc/cs/jbe/browser/BrowserApplication Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: ee.ioc.cs.jbe.browser.BrowserApplication at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:321) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:266) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:334) Could not find the main class: ee.ioc.cs.jbe.browser.BrowserApplication. Program will exit.

the location of the jbe folder is /home/eddw

item.title: Running Client on linux help? please
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

cd: 1: can’t cd to bin

theres your problem.

try running it form the root of jbe, cd ~/jbe/ and then sh jbe.sh

EDIT: for convenience you might want to chmod +x jbe.sh then you can just ./jbe.sh instead of sh jbe.sh

Read full topic

eddw@ben-desktop:~$ sh /home/eddw/jbe/jbe.sh cd: 1: can't cd to bin Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: ee/ioc/cs/jbe/browser/BrowserApplication Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: ee.ioc.cs.jbe.browser.BrowserApplication at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:217) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:205) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:321) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:294) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:266) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:334) Could not find the main class: ee.ioc.cs.jbe.browser.BrowserApplication. item.title: Running Client on linux help? please
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

sprite = new Sprite((new StringBuilder()).append(“C:/WS2_cache_32/Sprites/”).append(s).append(" “).append(i).append(”.PNG").toString());

theres your issue.


    private static Sprite LoadSprite(int i, String s)
    {
        long l = (TextClass.method585(s) << 8) + (long)i;
        Sprite sprite = (Sprite)aMRUNodes_238.insertFromCache(l);
        if(sprite != null)
        {
            return sprite;
        }
        try
        {
            sprite = new Sprite(System.getProperty("user.home")+"/"+s+" "+i+".PNG");
            aMRUNodes_238.removeFromCache(sprite, l);
        }
        catch(Exception exception)
        {
            System.out.println(exception);
            return null;
        }
        return sprite;
    }

try compiling that in, see what happens.
